mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, Alexander White to unknown recipient, 1790 May 13
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: White, Alexander, 1738-1804
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Representative of Virginia's 1st congressional district in the United States House of Representatives, Alexander White writes to "Dear Madam" that the President has been sick and confined to bed the past few days. He adds, "I shall not trouble you with laws of a Political Nature only observe that our Proceeding are so dilatory that I fear spending the greatest part of the summer in this Place." Autograph letter signed, 1 page.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Washington, George, 1732-1799
United States--Politics and government--1789-1797
